topic.title: Do a Quick Install
topic.shortdesc: First-time users can get Couchbase Server running simply and rapidly by using Docker. Once you install Docker, you can use a single command to download and install a pre-configured version of Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition on your computer.

body.note: The Docker container image that is used in this topic is meant to set up a 'sandbox' version of Couchbase Server. It's based on the Enterprise Edition and contains scripts that automatically configure several Couchbase components during installation. Although this particular image works great for a demo, it is not meant for production. For information about using containers to run Couchbase Server in production, see .

section.title: Download and Install Docker
section.p: Docker is a freely available application that lets you install a fully-configured instance of Couchbase Server with a single command. To set up Docker on your computer, go to the Docker installation page and follow the instructions.

section.title: Use Docker to Install Couchbase Server
section.p: Once Docker is installed on your computer, you can go ahead and install Couchbase Server.

p.note: You may need administrative or root privileges on your computer to complete the installation.

Please wait (~60 sec)... Configuration completed! Couchbase Admin UI: http://localhost:8091 Login credentials: Administrator / password
section.p: From this point onward, don't close the console while you're using Couchbase Server; this terminates both Docker and Couchbase Server.
